sense.name: (cause to) become thin
sense.commentary: Includes: THIN OUT Syntax includes: NP1[agent] THIN (out) (NP2[patient]) NP1[patient] THIN (out) [intransitive]
sense.examples: She thinned my hair out way too much, which left me with horrible looking layers. I'm actually impressed at how she thinned herself down. She thinned herself right out of existence. The crowd thinned out on Day 1, and the top two handset manufacturers were visibly absent. I added some protein to it, and thinned it with chicken stock to make it easier to pull through a straw. The inclusion of water effectively thinned the solution so that the rods would rise much quicker. The water thinned the mixture so that the meat would absorb it.
